channel.title: How to make a boolean return type?
channel.description:
Hey, im getting a compiler error "Missing Return Statement" and i read up on the compiler error guide and it said
"Your exercise is to make a method with a boolean return type which will return a boolean variable called aBoolean."
i cant work out how to do this though... could someone help me please?
thanks.

item.title: How to make a boolean return type?
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“reventix, post:8, topic:453627”]client.java:5025: error: cannot find symbol return aBoolean; ^ symbol: variable aBoolean location: class client 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

this is the boolean im using

public boolean aBoolean() {
    boolean aBoolean = false;
    return aBoolean;
}

And this is the code im using the Boolean for…

public boolean isinsafewild() { if((absX >= 3295 && absX <= 3312 && absY >= 3115 && absY <=3135)) if((absX >= 3200 && absX <= 3390 && absY >= 2979 && absY <=3135)) return true; else return aBoolean; } [/quote]
nonono. His code was psuedo code and was merely an example, not something to take from.

It should look like this;

public boolean isinsafewild() { if((absX >= 3295 && absX <= 3312 && absY >= 3115 && absY <=3135)) // first if condition if((absX >= 3200 && absX <= 3390 && absY >= 2979 && absY <=3135)) // second if condition that relies on the first return true; // now that the first and second cond. are true, we will return true if not then the jvm will keep reading till the next line. //else No need for the else, since the next line will be read if the above are not true. return false; // always need to return a certain type if the above never returns the true statement //return aBoolean; } i’m not so good at explaining…

And if you want look like a pro!

you can simply return the if statements as the boolean type.

public boolean isinsafewild() { return (absX >= 3295 && absX <= 3312 && absY >= 3115 && absY <=3135) && (absX >= 3200 && absX <= 3390 && absY >= 2979 && absY <=3135); }

Read full topic
item.source: How to make a boolean return type?

item.title: How to make a boolean return type?
item.dc:creator: @reventix reventix
item.description:
@reventix wrote:

client.java:5025: error: cannot find symbol return aBoolean; ^ symbol: variable aBoolean location: class client 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

this is the boolean im using

public boolean aBoolean() {
    boolean aBoolean = false;
    return aBoolean;
}

And this is the code im using the Boolean for…

public boolean isinsafewild() {
	if((absX >= 3295 && absX <= 3312 && absY >= 3115 && absY <=3135))
	if((absX >= 3200 && absX <= 3390 && absY >= 2979 && absY <=3135))
	return true;
	else
	return aBoolean;
	}

item.title: How to make a boolean return type?
item.dc:creator: @DannyIsSoPro DannyIsSoPro
item.description:
@DannyIsSoPro wrote:

Something like this:

boolean A = true;

The return type is true/false.

What are you doing anyway? O.O
